channel.title: The News Lens 關鍵評論網
channel.description: Myanmar Junta Forms Caretaker Government; Min Aung Hlaing is Prime Minister

item.title: Myanmar Junta Forms Caretaker Government; Min Aung Hlaing is Prime Minister
item.description: 6 months after coup, Myanmar military leader claims both recommitment to elections as well as working with ASEAN representatives.
item.content:encoded: 6 months after coup, Myanmar military leader claims both recommitment to elections as well as working with ASEAN representatives.
item.dc:creator: Voice of America

item.title: Survey: US Perceptions of China in the Early Biden Era
item.description: Our survey indicates a broadly shared concern about China in the United States, but not necessarily a consensus on what to do in regards to the economic challenges China poses.
item.content:encoded: Our survey indicates a broadly shared concern about China in the United States, but not necessarily a consensus on what to do in regards to the economic challenges China poses.
item.dc:creator: Timothy S. Rich

item.title: Mountain Hiking as Taiwan’s New National Pastime
item.description: Taiwan’s high mountains used to be closed to its citizens until the 1990s. Now, many are willing to take strenuous efforts to enjoy the high-altitude scenery.
item.content:encoded: Taiwan’s high mountains used to be closed to its citizens until the 1990s. Now, many are willing to take strenuous efforts to enjoy the high-altitude scenery.
item.dc:creator: Taiwan Insight

item.title: Indonesia: Indigenous Groups Face Covid Vaccine Barriers
item.description: Just under 1% of Indonesia's 17 million Indigenous people have been vaccinated. Bureaucratic and geographical obstacles are to blame for the low rate of inoculation.
item.content:encoded: Just under 1% of Indonesia's 17 million Indigenous people have been vaccinated. Bureaucratic and geographical obstacles are to blame for the low rate of inoculation.
item.dc:creator: Deutsche Welle

item.title: Hong Kong Hands Down First Guilty Sentence on Terrorism and Inciting Secession Charges Under National Security Law
item.description: The convicted protester Tong Ying-kit could face life in prison
item.content:encoded: The convicted protester Tong Ying-kit could face life in prison
item.dc:creator: Global Voices

item.title: Thailand Considers Cap on Vaccine Exports as Covid Cases Surge
item.description: An export cap could disrupt vaccine rollout in neighbor countries amid their own Covid spikes, health experts say.
item.content:encoded: An export cap could disrupt vaccine rollout in neighbor countries amid their own Covid spikes, health experts say.
item.dc:creator: Voice of America

item.title: China’s Numbers Game Harms Us All
item.description: As Beijing attempts to tackle some shared world problems, its opaque regime means the benefits are limited.
item.content:encoded: As Beijing attempts to tackle some shared world problems, its opaque regime means the benefits are limited.
item.dc:creator: The Interpreter

item.title: US Defense Secretary Heads to Southeast Asia
item.description: US Defense Secretary, Lloyd Austin, aims to unify allies concerned by China’s growing military abilities as the global coronavirus pandemic continues to cripple the region
item.content:encoded: US Defense Secretary, Lloyd Austin, aims to unify allies concerned by China’s growing military abilities as the global coronavirus pandemic continues to cripple the region
item.dc:creator: Voice of America

item.title: Taiwan’s Climate Change Action on Trial for the First Time
item.description: Taiwan’s economic ministry has been sued for a new regulation that could cause the country to fall behind the world on climate action.
item.content:encoded: Taiwan’s economic ministry has been sued for a new regulation that could cause the country to fall behind the world on climate action.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Chou

item.title: Falling Through The Cracks of Taiwan’s Immigration System
item.description: While the cautionary nature of Taiwan's approach to granting visas is praiseworthy, it can also turn a blind eye to situational, human ethics and doesn’t appear to be rational in every regard.
item.content:encoded: While the cautionary nature of Taiwan's approach to granting visas is praiseworthy, it can also turn a blind eye to situational, human ethics and doesn’t appear to be rational in every regard.
item.dc:creator: Henning von Mirbach

item.title: AI Protein Database Reveal is “a Great Leap” for Biology
item.description: The transformative AlphaFold neural network has predicted the structures of more than 350,000 proteins from various organisms. This could “fundamentally change biological research.”
item.content:encoded: The transformative AlphaFold neural network has predicted the structures of more than 350,000 proteins from various organisms. This could “fundamentally change biological research.”
item.dc:creator: Deutsche Welle

item.title: Tsunami of Chinese Marine Parks Drives Dolphins into Captivity
item.description: With the growth of the aquatic entertainment industry, trade in marine animals is gathering speed in China.
item.content:encoded: With the growth of the aquatic entertainment industry, trade in marine animals is gathering speed in China.
item.dc:creator: Gregory McCann

item.title: Report: China Considering Foreign Booster Shot to Improve Efficacy of Its Vaccines
item.description: Experts suggest such a move might not dissipate the goodwill China gained from donating or selling doses to other countries.
item.content:encoded: Experts suggest such a move might not dissipate the goodwill China gained from donating or selling doses to other countries.
item.dc:creator: Voice of America

item.title: China: Heavy Rains Cause Deadly Floods in Henan Province
item.description: At least 12 people have died following flash floods in the central Chinese province of Henan. Thousands more have been evacuated after the heaviest rains in decades.
item.content:encoded: At least 12 people have died following flash floods in the central Chinese province of Henan. Thousands more have been evacuated after the heaviest rains in decades.
item.dc:creator: Deutsche Welle

item.title: Released Journalists Share Prison Experiences in Myanmar
item.description: In late June, the Myanmar military government released more than 2,000 prisoners arrested for resisting the coup, including 12 journalists. At least 36 journalists are still in detention.
item.content:encoded: In late June, the Myanmar military government released more than 2,000 prisoners arrested for resisting the coup, including 12 journalists. At least 36 journalists are still in detention.
item.dc:creator: Global Voices

item.title: How a Taiwanese Baseball Player Strengthens Taiwan-Japan Relations
item.description: Wang Po-jung’s action serves as an example of how non-state actors can contribute to diplomacy.
item.content:encoded: Wang Po-jung’s action serves as an example of how non-state actors can contribute to diplomacy.
item.dc:creator: Nelson Chung

item.title: Covid Vaccination Rate ‘Must Increase Rapidly’, WHO, Red Cross Warn
item.description: WHO warns that global vaccination efforts need to be stepped up as Myanmar experiences ‘crippling Covid-19 crisis’
item.content:encoded: WHO warns that global vaccination efforts need to be stepped up as Myanmar experiences ‘crippling Covid-19 crisis’
item.dc:creator: Voice of America

item.title: Follow Old-School Taipeiers Through Dalongdong
item.description: Like other settlements along the Tamsui River, Dalongdong was one of the first areas to develop in Taipei. It’s also a traditional gathering place for literary and artistic youth in Taipei.
item.content:encoded: Like other settlements along the Tamsui River, Dalongdong was one of the first areas to develop in Taipei. It’s also a traditional gathering place for literary and artistic youth in Taipei.
item.dc:creator: TAIPEI
